job_description: Job Description:Risk Workstation Product Area – Associate EngineerNote: Fidelity will not provide immigration sponsorship for this positionThe RoleWe are seeing an associate full stack engineer to join the Risk Workstation Product Area to develop high-quality applications servicing Risk and other business units. You will have the opportunity to be part of the team to modernize this critical application that allows the firm to manage many types of risks. The Expertise and Skills You BringCollege degree in Computer Science or Data Science or related field.Your Ability to learn quickly and master new technologies and business domain knowledge.Your Ability to work with cross functional team and handle multiple tasks and priorities.Good understanding on software life cycle methodologies.Good understanding in Java is required.Python, SQL and configuration management tools such as Github, Jenkins are nice to have.Good understanding on Machine learning, Artificial intelligence related technologies is a nice to have.Analytical skills that will ensure satisfactory problem resolution for our clients and deliver solutions to complex challenges.Effective written and verbal communication skills, ability to adopt corporate culture quickly and work as team player.Take the initiative to learn new functions and engage in inter-departmental training.Look for opportunities to develop new procedures on an on-going basis to enhance the documentation process.Fidelity’s hybrid working model blends the best of both onsite and offsite work experiences. Having the majority of our associates work onsite is important for our business strategy and our culture. We also value the benefits that working offsite offers associates. Most roles listed as Hybrid will require associates to work onsite all business days of every other week in a Fidelity office. This does not apply to roles listed as Remote or Onsite.Certifications:Category:Information TechnologyMost roles at Fidelity are Hybrid, requiring associates to work onsite every other week (all business days, M-F) in a Fidelity office. This does not apply to Remote or fully Onsite roles.Please be advised that Fidelity’s business is governed by the provisions of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, the Investment Company Act of 1940, ERISA, numerous state laws governing securities, investment and retirement-related financial activities and the rules and regulations of numerous self-regulatory organizations, including FINRA, among others. Those laws and regulations may restrict Fidelity from hiring and/or associating with individuals with certain Criminal Histories.
